content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="http://mrdata.usgs.gov/laterite/laterite.xsl"?><record id="8"><agegrp>b</agegrp><dep10km>Au-quartz veins; Cu-Zn VMS; Ni laterite</dep10km><comments>The smaller Murrin Murrin South area is located 9 km south of the main Murrin Murrin North site. According to Australian Atlas of Mines (1999) and Mining-Technology (2007), the combined reserve of both deposits (JORC) consists of  145 Mt at 1.07% Ni qnd 0.085% Co (0.8% Ni cutoff grade), and the resource is 334 Mt  at 1% Ni and 0.064% Co (0.8% Ni cutoff grade). Exploration drilling included 4,487 m blast-percussion 278 holes; 118,065 m reverse circulation 4082 holes; 262.1 m diamond core drilling in 12 holes (Fazakerley and Monti, 1998). In 2006 the mine produced 31,524 t Ni and 2,069 t Co (Mining-Technology, 2007). Ni atoms are distributed within the smectite layers (Gaudin and others, 2005). Paleomagnetic dating of ferruginous saprolite indicates Mesozoic and Tertiary weathering events (Wells, 2003).</comments><country>Australia</country><cntrycd>AUWA</cntrycd><deparea>68</deparea><deplength>11.5</deplength><depshape>blanket on plateau</depshape><depthick>20</depthick><depwidth>7.5</depwidth><discdate>1975</discdate><hpal>yes</hpal><includes>Murrin Murrin North, Murrin Murrin South</includes><latthick>40</latthick><latitude>-28.7677777777778</latitude><latdeg>-28</latdeg><latmin>-46</latmin><latsec>-4</latsec><longitude>121.891111111111</longitude><londeg>121</londeg><lonmin>53</lonmin><lonsec>28</lonsec><depname>Murrin Murrin</depname><other_rx>felsic volcanics and volcaniclastics, gabbro, granitoid, mafic volcanics, pyroxenite</other_rx><overburden>10</overburden><owneroper>Anaconda Nickel Ltd. (60%), Glencore International AG (40%)</owneroper><plateau>yes</plateau><nirecovpct>83</nirecovpct><srcbedrock>serpentinite, serpentinized peridotite</srcbedrock><startdate>1998</startdate><stprov>Western Australia</stprov><status>open-cast mining operations</status><subtype>(I) clay silicate</subtype><tectset>Archean Yilgarn craton, Norseman-Wiluna greenstone belt</tectset><ageweather>Late Eocene\ufffd\ufffdOligocene</ageweather><deptype>1</deptype><qstatus>P</qstatus><mineral role="nickeliferous">chlorite</mineral><mineral role="other">calcite</mineral><mineral role="other">dolomite</mineral><mineral role="other">magnesite</mineral><mineral role="other">magnetite</mineral><mineral role="other">opal</mineral><mineral
